    • Method Detail

      • single

        public static <T> Collector<T,?,T> single()
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Collect a single element. The Collector throws IllegalArgumentException if no or more than one element.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Element type
        Returns:
        The single element collector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • singleOrEmpty

        public static <T> Collector<T,?,Optional<T>> singleOrEmpty()
        Eventually collect a single element. The Collector throws IllegalArgumentException if more than one element.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Element type
        Returns:
        The optional single element collector

      • toMap

        public static <T extends Map.Entry<K,U>,K,U> Collector<T,?,Map<K,U>> toMap()
        Collect map entries into a HashMap. The Collector throws NullPointerException if one entry has a null value. The Collector throws IllegalStateException if duplicate keys are found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Map entry type
        K - the collected map key type
        U - the collected map value type
        Returns:
        a Collector which collects elements into a Map

      • toMap

        public static <T extends Map.Entry<K,U>,K,U,M extends Map<K,U>> Collector<T,?,M> toMap(Supplier<M> mapSupplier)
        Collect map entries into a map. The Collector throws NullPointerException if one entry has a null value. The Collector throws IllegalStateException if duplicate keys are found.
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of the resulting Map
        T - the Map entry type
        K - the collected map key type
        U - the collected map value type
        Parameters:
        mapSupplier - a function which returns a new, empty Map into which the results will be inserted
        Returns:
        The map collector

      • toMap

        public static <T,K,U,M extends Map<K,U>> Collector<T,?,M> toMap(Function<? super T,? extends K> keyMapper,
                                                                Function<? super T,? extends U> valueMapper,
                                                                Supplier<M> mapSupplier)
        Collect map entries into a map. The Collector throws NullPointerException if one entry has a null value. The Collector throws IllegalStateException if duplicate keys are found.
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of the resulting Map
        T - the Map entry type
        K - the collected map key type
        U - the collected map value type
        Parameters:
        keyMapper - a mapping function to produce keys
        valueMapper - a mapping function to produce values
        mapSupplier - a function which returns a new, empty Map into which the results will be inserted
        Returns:
        The map collector

      • toMapWithNullValues

        public static <T extends Map.Entry<K,U>,K,U> Collector<T,?,Map<K,U>> toMapWithNullValues()
        Collect map entries into a HashMap, allowing null values. The Collector throws IllegalStateException if duplicate keys are found. See https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8148463
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Map entry type
        K - the collected map key type
        U - the collected map value type
        Returns:
        The map collector

        Collect map entries into a map, allowing null values. The Collector throws IllegalStateException if duplicate keys are found. See https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8148463
        Type Parameters:

        T - the Map entry type
        K - the collected map key type
        U - the collected map value type
